documentation.text: @dev used to define a new loans quantity of tokens to mint
@dev used to get accruances while staking
@dev used to calculate interest when unstaking
@dev used to check if borrower is calling a function
@dev can only be called by bonds contract. Updates the total due
@dev is used to make sure new loans can only be minted if actually new

@title Bonds
 @author Carson Case
 @dev bellow are some notes on improvements
   -figure out compound staking interest
       *compare complexity/gas
   -allow multiple users/loans per contract
   -unstakeAmmount()
   -Fix issue with unstakeAll not sending nfts but instead minting
   -See if holding functions can be imported/interfaced
   -Create interface for this contract. Seperate file
   -Move metadata url to non magic variable

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Only the borrower of this contract can mint the bonds to it"

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "You must pay off your current loan before starting a new one"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You are not staking any NFTs"

arguments.value: You are not staking any NFTs

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "You are not staking any NFTs"

documentation.text:
@notice function calculates interest earned over time staking and mints that along with your staking balance
 @notice the addInterest function (which only this contract can preform) also updates total ammount due to contract

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You are not staking any NFTs"

arguments.value: You are not staking any NFTs

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "You are not staking any NFTs"

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address,address,uint256[] memory,uint256[] memory,bytes memory) external returns (bytes4)

devdoc.author: Carson Case
devdoc.details: interface for paymentContract As of right now, each payment contract can only have 1 address (borrower). And they can only mint identical NFTs. In the future I'd like to have the standard allow for shared use of the contracts as it can make things a lot more user friendly.

accrualPeriod().details: used to get accruances while staking

addInterest(uint256).details: can only be called by bonds contract. Updates the total due

borrower().details: used to check if borrower is calling a function

interestRateInverse().details: used to calculate interest when unstaking

isComplete().details: is used to make sure new loans can only be minted if actually new

principal().details: used to define a new loans quantity of tokens to mint

devdoc.title: paymentContract

userdoc.notice: these are the REQUIRED functions of a pyament contract. More is possible and encouraged. But these are the only ways that the bonds contract will interact with them
